alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 10:49AM EST until January 10 at 7:24PM EST by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed to Minor severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in Georgia... Etowah River at Canton affecting Cherokee County. For the Etowah River Basin...including Russell Creek downstream of Head Lake Dawsonville, Landrum, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Dawsonville, Matt, Ball Ground, Canton, Old GA 5 below Ball Ground, Canton, Canton, Waleska, Woodstock, Noonday Creek above Chastain Meadows Pkwy Marietta, Woodstock, Woodstock, Kennesaw, Acworth, Allatoona Dam above Cartersville, Dallas, Cartersville, Rockmart, Kingston, Kingston, Rome, Rome...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Etowah River at Canton. * WHEN...Until this evening. * IMPACTS...At 17.0 feet, Minor flooding continues in the woodlands and fields along the river upstream and downstream from the gage by the Walaska Street bridge. Portions of recreational areas such as Boling Park behind the Cherokee County High School...the Cherokee County Fairgrounds and the Etowah River Greenway at Heritage Park will be flooded with up to one foot of water. The parking lot at Boling Park will begin to flood. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:15 AM EST Wednesday the stage was 17.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 10:15 AM EST Wednesday was 17.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 3.9 feet Monday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 17.0 feet on 10/06/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued this evening at 730 PM EST.
